snippet: Anger over what local residents call the mine’s unbridled expansion represents the latest instance of hostility toward China by Asian neighbors.
abstract: Villagers in Myanmar seize two Chinese employees of a copper mine; although employees are released, local residents say they remain embittered about mining's impact on the area; conflict comes at time when overlapping territorial claims between China and its southern neighbors have resulted in rising tensions.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe contributed reporting from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: Anger over what local residents call the mine’s unbridled expansion represents the latest instance of hostility toward China by Asian neighbors.

headline.main: Resentment of China Spreading in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Resentment of China Spreading in Myanmar
